sentences: Koridori akna all on väike pink.
Töötaja liigub koridoris mööda kõiki ruume.
Me peame puhastama koridori enne tähtsat kohtumist.
context: In Estonian, 'koridori' is the partitive form of the word 'koridor'. The base word 'koridor' means corridor or hallway - a passage connecting rooms in a building. The partitive case (-i ending) indicates that someone is moving along the corridor, near it, or describing something related to it. This is commonly used when indicating movement within or location relative to a corridor.
